intro: Dysphania tibetica, commonly known as Tibetan Chenopodium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in cool, arid environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Dysphania tibetica is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that can withstand extreme temperatures.
